cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across Hispaniola, then near the Turks & Caicos and southeastern Bahamas Thursday, skirting the north-central Cuban coast late Thursday/Friday and eventually aiming toward South Florida and the eastern Gulf of Mexico.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern coast of central Cuba (near Camagüey/Holguín provinces)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch for northern Haiti, Turks & Caicos, southeastern Bahamas, several Cuban provinces
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for portions of the Dominican Republic coastline
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, southeastern and central Bahamas, northern Cuba, eventually South Florida / eastern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of tropical-storm-force gusts (mainly squalls) possible early Wednesday while center passed south-west of the island; otherwise breezy easterly flow.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for San Juan as the storm is now well west of Puerto Rico.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of additional rain possible in lingering outer bands, producing localized street flooding but widespread totals under 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along north-facing beaches through Wednesday night.
